snippet: Lack of oversight offshore helps tax evaders, criminals and terrorists.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Robert M Morgenthau, former Manhattan district attorney, warns that financial secrecy laws in offshore tax havens are at the root of serious crimes such as fraud, money laundering and international terrorism; urges the United States to direct its banks and their foreign subsidiaries not to engage in financial transactions in countries that have no transparency and no disclosure of the true parties of interest in financial transactions. Drawing (M)
lead_paragraph: FANS of ''American Idol'' might be surprised to learn that, if sales figures are any indication, the real music capital of the world may not be America, but Luxembourg. Luxembourg is a tax haven, and Apple funnels more than a billion dollars worth of iTunes sales through that tiny country to avoid paying higher taxes.

headline.main: These Islands Aren't Just a Shelter From Taxes
